intro: Wahlenbergia rupicola, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy blooms during the cooler months. Wahlenbergia rupicola is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
